subject: Sexual Health
title: Digital Literacy for Teens
description: A quick, practical guide to Digital Literacy for Teens.

hook.text: Teens today learn about bodies and sex online long before any classroom lesson. The sources matter.

buildup.text: Studies show that most teens encounter pornography before age 14, shaping unrealistic expectations about sex and bodies.

discovery.text: Digital literacy teaches teens to critically evaluate online content and distinguish fact from fantasy.

twist.text: Blocking content alone does not work. Teaching critical thinking is more effective than restrictive filters.

climax.text: Equipping teens with media literacy skills helps them navigate a digital world with healthier perspectives.

punchline.text: Teach them to think critically, not just to avoid content.

quiz.question: What is more effective than content blocking for protecting teens online?
options: Teaching critical thinking and media literacy
